result.execSummary:
The defendant Demetri D Shurn was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: any other sentence.  Release for Day Reporting Center and inmate work assignments. Credit for four days (4/2/14-4/6/14).  Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring.

miscConds.notes: Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges including DNA surcharge during the course of probation to probation agent.  Any remaning balance due at the end of probation will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered.
Enroll and regularly participate in a GED or HSED program.  Maintain fulltime work and/or school.
Mental health evaluation and any recommended treatment.    Court suggests Trauma Informed Care.

No alcohol.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as presribed.
No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm holster, firearm magazine, or any body armor.
Participate in alcohol and drug assessment. Successfully complete recommended treatment including drug and alcohol testing.  Maintain absolute sobriety.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176 the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions: firearm possession and voting.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Demetri D Shurn

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Demetri D Shurn in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Defendant Demetri D Shurn in custody.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.
Court ordered defendant to serve 12 MONTHS in the House of Correction consecutive to any sentence; release for the Day Reporting Center and inmate work assignments; credit for 4 days time served (4-2-2014  4-6-2014). Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring. 
Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on probation for 24 MONTHS with the following conditions:
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
- Maintain Absolute Sobriety, no alcohol.
- No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid 
  prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
- Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
  and successfully complete recommended treatment
  including drug and alcohol testing. 
- Defendant to enroll and regularly participate in a GED or HSED program. 
- Maintain full time work and/or school.
- No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
- No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm holster, firearm magazine, or any body armor.
- Mental Health Evaluation and any recommended treatment. Court suggests Trauma Informed Care. 
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 
-Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, during the course of probation to the probation agent. Any remaining balance due at the end of probation will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered. 

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 
Filed;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
signed Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant Demetri D Shurn in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Defendant Demetri D Shurn in custody.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
AS TO COUNT  1- 
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

Court ordered the defendant REMANDED into custody.  
Case adjourned for Sentencing on 3-18-2015 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 17.

Attorney Daryl A Kastenson in court, defendant Demetri D Shurn not in court, in custody.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is in custody, produced but not in court for the purposes of scheduling.
Case held off the record. Case scheduled for Plea and Sentencing. Attorney Kastenson is in trial in another court and requests adjournment. Case is adjourned for Plea and Sentencing on 3-3-2015 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 17.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Daryl A Kastenson in court, defendant Demetri D Shurn not in court, in custody.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is produced, not brought to the courtroom for off the record hearing. Case held off the record. For the reasons presented to the Court off the record the case is adjourned for Plea and Sentencing on 2-24-2015 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 17.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision. The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.   No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed, no drug paraphernalia and no alcohol.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. Defendant may not possess cash in an amount greater than $150.00 in coins or bills at one time. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Attorney Daryl A. Kastenson in court, defendant Demetri D Shurn not in court, in custody.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case scheduled for Return on Warrant. Arguments heard as to bail. Court forfeits cash bail previously posted. Court sets cash bail. Case is adjourned for Plea and Sentencing on 1-23-2015 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 17.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Bench warrant served. Original in Court file.
Justice Point Discharge Summary received and filed.  alp
Received and filed with court.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.
Attorney Mark A Dluzak in court.  Danielle E Chojnacki appeared for Paul Hauer for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.
Violation Report received and filed with the court.
Received and filed with court.
Defendant Demetri D Shurn in court with attorney Mark A Dluzak.  Paul M Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 12, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Demetri D Shurn in court with attorney Mark A Dluzak.  Hanna R Kolberg appeared for Paul Hauer for the State of Wisconsin. Case adjourned for a Projected Guilty Plea Hearing in Branch 26.  COURT WILL RETAIN FILE.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 23, 2014 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Demetri D Shurn in court with attorney Mark A Dluzak.  Paul M Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  eam
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 8, 2014 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.

Defendant Demetri D Shurn in court with attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub.  Defendant Demetri D Shurn in custody.  William Patrick Pipp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge POCAN, Branch 26.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 18, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
